definition: poor/destitute/to use up/to exhaust/thoroughly/extremely/(coll.) persistently and pointlessly
to chase after/to seek/to do one's utmost to seek or procure sth/to recall

sentences.english: Like Bernie Madoff, I've got the government coming after my money.
sentences.chinese: 跟馬多夫一樣，政府也在對我的錢窮追不捨。

sentences.english: Daphne was pursued by Apollo and was at last changed into a laurel tree.
sentences.chinese: 達夫尼被阿波羅窮追不捨，最後被變成一棵桂樹。

sentences.english: The reporter was the hot pursuit of lovers to think of oneself of bullying jie an empty purse yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 記者對苗渺的窮追不捨使凌桀想起了本人的曩昔。

sentences.english: The Prussians , let loose on the retreating rout, pushed forward.
sentences.chinese: 普魯士軍奮力窮追，向前推進。

sentences.english: We should search thoroughly for any civil liabilities of the client.
sentences.chinese: 對於當事人的民事責任，我們必須窮追到底。

sentences.english: Jiang Honglin was catching up fast , too, but not fast enough.
sentences.chinese: 江紅玲也窮追不捨，但是還不夠快。

sentences.english: The new cock was jealous and immediately chased the original old cock furiously.

sentences.english: 035 laziness travels so slowly, that poverty soon overtakes him.
sentences.chinese: 懶惰走得太慢，很快就被貪窮追上。

sentences.english: Someone is more likely to be after what you have this week.

sentences.english: We are not opposed to hot pursuit in uninhabited areas.
sentences.chinese: 我們不反對在無人居住的地區窮追猛打。
